attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"system_prompt": "You are Roadcast's documentation concierge. Blend GitBook product docs with runtime RAG snippets to provide crisp, actionable answers for internal operators. Every reply must be factual, cite numbered references, and clearly separate summaries from implementation steps.", "user_question": "tell me about bolt", "snippets": ["[1] Title: Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User
Real-time fleet intelligence and configurable workflows that keep product owners and consumers moving in sync.
What it is
: Bolt is a unified operations intelligence platform for organizations that manage fleets, field assets, and on-ground personnel. It merges real-time visibility, configurable workflows, and deep reporting into a single web experience.
Who it’s for
:
Product Owners: orchestrate programs, configure roles, and align KPIs.
Portal Operators: run daily operations—devices, trips, notifications, incidents, yard logistics.
Pu", "[2] Title: Reports & Analytics | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/reports-and-analytics
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
Reports & Analytics
hashtag
Automated Reporting
Turn-Around Time (TAT):
Specialized reports for Yard managers to track facility efficiency.
Escalation Reports:
Review logs of critical events that required supervisor intervention.
Custom Engine:
Build your own reports by selecting specific columns, filters, and scheduling them for email delivery.
hashtag
AI Assistant
Natural Language Queries:
Use the chat interface to ask questions like "Which drivers exceeded speed limits today?" or "Show me idle vehicles in the North region."
Previous
Billing & Enterprise Wal", "[3] Title: Home | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
house
Home
Start here. Learn the product fast, find the right workflows, and get back to ops.
hashtag
Welcome to the BOLT V2 docs
You’re in the right place if you run fleets, field assets, or on‑ground teams.
This space helps you go from “what is BOLT?” to “ship it in production”.
circle-info
These docs are written for operators and product owners first.
If you’re integrating systems, start with the overview.
hashtag
Pick your path
I’m new here
→ get the big picture, then learn the core concepts.
I’m running ops today
→ find workflows, exceptions, and day‑to‑day actions.", "[4] Title: UI/UX Specifications & Design System | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/ui-ux-specifications-and-design-system
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
UI/UX Specifications & Design System
This section outlines the visual standards, interaction logic, and user experience principles that define the Bolt V2 platform.
hashtag
Unified Design Language
Bolt V2 uses a utility-first design system built on
Tailwind CSS
. The goal is to provide a clean, high-performance interface that prioritizes data visibility.
Management Hub Approach:
The interface is split into two distinct modes:
Admin Side (Roadcast):
Designed for high-density data management, bulk configurations, and global oversight.
Client Side:
Designed for o"], "format_instructions": "If a query cannot be answered from the provided snippets, say so explicitly and recommend which doc to read.
Use the format: ## Direct Answer, ## Key Details (bullets), ## References (numbered list).
Always mention the reference number in-line like [1] whenever referencing a fact.
Keep answers under 220 words unless the user asks for exhaustive detail.
Highlight commands or API names with backticks.
Never hallucinate URLs; always reuse the snippet URLs provided.
Follow the template strictly:
## Direct Answer
<2-3 sentence summary>
## Key Details
- Bullet fact with inline [number]
- Another fact
## References
[List every reference as [n] Title — URL]
Keep the overall response under 150 words unless the user explicitly asks for a detailed or long explanation."}
attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"answer_markdown": "## Direct Answer
Bolt is a unified operations intelligence platform designed for organizations managing fleets, field assets, and on-ground personnel. It provides real-time visibility, configurable workflows, and deep reporting within a single web interface to streamline operations and align teams.

## Key Details
- Bolt V2 offers real-time fleet intelligence and configurable workflows to keep product owners and consumers synchronized [1].
- It serves multiple roles including product owners who orchestrate programs and portal operators who manage daily operations like devices, trips, and incidents [1].
- The platform uses a utility-first design system based on Tailwind CSS, focusing on a clean, high-performance interface with distinct admin and client modes [4].

## References
[1] Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation  
[4] UI/UX Specifications & Design System — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/ui-ux-specifications-and-design-system"}

attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:

    user_question = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'End-user query to answer', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'User Question:'})
    snippets = Field(annotation=List[str] required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'List of numbered passages generated from GitBook search results', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'Snippets:'})
    format_instructions = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'Explicit formatting instructions, including headings and reference block template', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'Format Instructions:'})
    answer_markdown = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'Well-structured markdown answer that cites references in-text and ends with a references list', '__dspy_field_type': 'output', 'prefix': 'Answer Markdown:'})
)", "demos": [], "inputs": {"system_prompt": "You are Roadcast's documentation concierge. [{"role": "system", "content": "Your input fields are:
1. `system_prompt` (str): Agent system prompt describing persona and guardrails
2. `user_question` (str): End-user query to answer
3. `snippets` (list[str]): List of numbered passages generated from GitBook search results
4. `format_instructions` (str): Explicit formatting instructions, including headings and reference block template
Your output fields are:
1. `answer_markdown` (str): Well-structured markdown answer that cites references in-text and ends with a references list
All interactions will be structured in the following way, with the appropriate values filled in.

[[ ## system_prompt ## ]]
{system_prompt}

[[ ## user_question ## ]]
{user_question}

[[ ## snippets ## ]]
{snippets}

[[ ## format_instructions ## ]]
{format_instructions}

[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]
{answer_markdown}

[[ ## completed ## ]]

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
["[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]
## Direct Answer
Bolt is a unified operations intelligence platform designed for organizations managing fleets, field assets, and on-ground personnel. It provides real-time visibility, configurable workflows, and deep reporting within a single web interface to streamline operations and align teams.

## Key Details
- Bolt V2 offers real-time fleet intelligence and configurable workflows to keep product owners and consumers synchronized [1].
- It serves multiple roles including product owners who orchestrate programs and portal operators who manage daily operations like devices, trips, and incidents [1].
- The platform uses a utility-first design system based on Tailwind CSS, focusing on a clean, high-performance interface with distinct admin and client modes [4].

## References
[1] Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation  
[4] UI/UX Specifications & Design System — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/ui-ux-specifications-and-design-system  
[[ ## completed ## ]]"]

attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"signature": "GitBookAnswerSignature(system_prompt, user_question, snippets, format_instructions -> answer_markdown
    instructions='Formats GitBook search snippets into a markdown answer with references.'
    system_prompt = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'Agent system prompt describing persona and guardrails', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'System Prompt:'})
    user_question = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'End-user query to answer', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'User Question:'})
    snippets = Field(annotation=List[str] required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'List of numbered passages generated from GitBook search results', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'Snippets:'})
    format_instructions = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'Explicit formatting instructions, including headings and reference block template', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'Format Instructions:'})
    answer_markdown = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'Well-structured markdown answer that cites references in-text and ends with a references list', '__dspy_field_type': 'output', 'prefix': 'Answer Markdown:'})
)", "completion": "[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]

Bolt is a unified operations intelligence platform designed for organizations managing fleets, field assets, and on-ground personnel. It provides real-time visibility, configurable workflows, and deep reporting within a single web interface to streamline operations and align teams.

{"answer_markdown": "## Direct Answer
Bolt is a unified operations intelligence platform designed for organizations managing fleets, field assets, and on-ground personnel. It provides real-time visibility, configurable workflows, and deep reporting within a single web interface to streamline operations and align teams.

## Key Details
- Bolt V2 offers real-time fleet intelligence and configurable workflows to keep product owners and consumers synchronized [1].
- It serves multiple roles including product owners who orchestrate programs and portal operators who manage daily operations like devices, trips, and incidents [1].
- The platform uses a utility-first design system based on Tailwind CSS, focusing on a clean, high-performance interface with distinct admin and client modes [4].

## References
[1] Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation  
[4] UI/UX Specifications & Design System — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/ui-ux-specifications-and-design-system"}
